result.execSummary:
The defendant Anthony D Griffin was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Anthony D Griffin is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Anthony D Griffin was found guilty of Substantial Battery-Intend Bodily Harm [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(2).
  • Anthony D Griffin was found guilty of Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.descr: DE competent to stand trial, suspension lifted

records.addlTxt: Defendant Anthony D Griffin in court with attorney thomas raymond cotey.  Defendant Anthony D Griffin in custody.  Porchia Lewand appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for return on doctors report.  Parties do not contest the report.   Court finds the defendant is competent to proceed and reinstates the proceedings.
Invoice dated 3/30/18 Sent to AP 4/4/18 in the amount of $500.00 to Dr. Deborah Collins  for services on 3/12/18, 3/19/18, 3/20/18.

Defendant Anthony D Griffin in court with attorney thomas raymond cotey.  Defendant Anthony D Griffin in custody.  Porchia Lewand appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Competency Hearing proceeded.  State does not challenge Dr. Collins report. Defendant requests to go to hospital for treatment. For reasons as set forth, Court finds defendant incompetent to proceed at this time.  Court found the defendant is not competent to refuse psychotropic medication or treatment due to mental illness because the defendant is incapable of expressing an understanding of the advantages and disadvantages of accepting psychotropic medication or treatment.  Court ordered defendant commitment for treatment for incompetency.  Order signed and filed.  The sheriff shall arrange for transportation of the defendant to the treatment facility. The Department of Health and Family Services is authorized to administer psychotropic medication or treatment to the defendant, and shall observe appropriate medical standards.  Court ordered case adjourned for return on doctor's report on May 1, 2018 at 1:30 pm in Branch 36. Doctor's Report Return scheduled for May 1, 2018 at 01:30 pm.
Order of Commitment for Treatment, signed & filed.
Doctor's Report dated 3/20/18, filed.

Attorney thomas raymond cotey in court, defendant Anthony D Griffin not in court, in custody, waived appearance.  Porchia Lewand appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: STW
Case set for Doctor's Report Return. Court reorders competency evaluation to be completed by Dr. Deborah Collins, specifically taken care of by post-conviction proceedings. Case adjourned for Return on Doctor's Report, Branch 36.  Doctor's Report Return scheduled for March 23, 2018 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Thomas Raymond Cotey in court, defendant Anthony D Griffin not in court, in custody, waived appearance.  Jennifer Jean Tate appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: STW
Case set for status conference. Court orders competency evaluation. Case adjourned for Return on Doctors Report, Branch 36.  Doctor's Report Return scheduled for February 16, 2018 at 08:30 am.
Per the court, contacted Attorney Cotey to schedule status conference. Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 36 on January 16, 2018 at 1:30 p.m.   Deputy Court Clerk: TC.
Per Order of the Presiding Judge, Misdemeanor Division, this request/motion is hereby assigned to the Hon. Jeffrey A. Kremers, Br. 36, calendar successor, for review. spc

Letter from DOC seeking clarification of sentence.
Request to Correct Clerical Report.

Court sentenced defendant on 06-12-2015 as to Counts 1 and 3.   Confinement time on those counts was CONCURRENT.  Court ordered defendant be placed on probation for a period of 3 years.  
Judgment of Conviction was issued on Count 1 that defendant serve confinement in the Wisconsin State Prison.
As the confinement time was concurrent, the probation ordered applied to both counts.

Judgment of conviction to be amended as to Count 1 with the terms of probation as stated in the sentencing entry of 06-12-2015.

Sentencing entry to be amended to state:
As to Count 1 and Count 3:

(Court stayed the sentence and placed defendant on probation....)    All other terms, etc regarding the sentencing entry of 06-12-2015 in the CCAP record remains as previously recorded.

Request and Order forwarded to the Court for Court's review and approval.
records.descr: Request and Order to Correct Clerical Error in JOC

records.addlTxt: Probation Review Hearing scheduled for 09-18-2015 at 01:30 pm.

Sentencing proceeded.  State has complied with victim notification.  Statements by the State, defense counsel and defendant as to sentencing.

As to Count 1: 
COURT ORDERS defendant to serve a term in the Wisconsin State Prison system - TOTAL LENGTH OF SENTENCE -  3 and 1/2 years with 65 days credit -  INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT -  18 months  -  EXTENDED SUPERVISION -  2  years.  

Court finds defendant is NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program but IS eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.

As to Count 3:
Court ordered defendant to serve 9 months in the House of Correction CONCURRENT to the sentence imposed as to Count 1; credit for 65 days served.

Court STAYED the sentence and placed defendant on probation for 3  YEARS with the following conditions:
- Defendant to be supervised by the Mental Health unit
- Court ordered 45 days in the House of Correction; stayed for the use at the discretion of the probation department.
- Successfully complete a BIP training program
- Comply with any treatment or programming ordered by probation
- AODA assessment; comply with any treatment.
- No contact with the victims
- Court sets Restitution at $0 (zero)
- Pay all costs, fees, assessments and surcharges including the DV assessment and DNA surcharge.  Monies owed to be paid during the term of probation.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
- Pay all supervision fees
- No contact with firearms
- Attend the probation review hearing on 09-18-2015.

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
- Defendant to be supervised by the Mental Health unit
- Successfully complete a BIP training program
- Comply with any treatment or programming ordered by probation
- AODA assessment; comply with any treatment.
- No contact with the victims
- Court sets Restitution at $0 (zero)
- Pay all costs, fees, assessments and surcharges including the DV assessment and DNA surcharge.  Monies owed to be paid during the term of extended supervision.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
- Pay all supervision fees
- No contact with firearms

COURT ORDERS:
-  defendant to provide a biological specimen for DNA analysis

Appeal rights given.  Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief and Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgment received and filed.  Copies given to the defendant.

As to Count 1 and Amended Count 3:
Defendant waives constitutional rights, enters a plea of GUILTY and is examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum  received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the Complaint as a factual basis for judgment.  Court finds defendant guilty as charged in the Information/Complaint and as amended and enters a judgment of conviction.

COURT ADVISES the defendant he may be deported if not a U.S. citizen, he cannot possess firearms or body armor, he must provide a DNA sample, pay the mandatory DNA surcharge and cannot vote until his civil rights are restored.  

As to Count 2 and Count 4:
Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court orders Count 2 and Count 4 DISMISSED.

Parties are prepared to proceed to sentencing.

Defendant Anthony D Griffin in court with attorney Victoria Mccandless.  Defendant Anthony D Griffin in custody.  Benjamin Lindsay appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
On motion of the State, Court orders Count 3 AMENDED as follow:
Battery, a Class A misdemeanor, contrary to Wisconsin State Stats. 940.19(1)

Defendant is prepared to enter a plea.
Clerk:  jms

At the parties request, case is calendared for a plea and sentencing hearing on 06/12/2015 at 01:30 p.m., in Room 629 of the Courthouse, Judge McAdams presiding.

Attorney Victoria Mccandless in court, defendant Anthony D Griffin not in court, in custody.  Owen M. Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense counsel requests case be set for a Plea & Sentencing date in branch 23.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 23, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Anthony D Griffin in court with attorney Victoria Mccandless.  Defendant Anthony D Griffin in custody.  Benjamin Lindsay appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
BRANCH 40 FOR BRANCH 23.
Case set for Preliminary Hearing. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver, received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial before Judge Grady, Branch 23. Original Information, received and filed. Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defendant plead not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned to Branch 23.  Court advised defendant that the no contact order remains in effect.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 1, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  DEFENDANT to be monitored by drug testing.  No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Latanya C.; Hykesha W. or her children; PA Samuel S. (unless the Defendant has a legitimate need for medical treatmentt at St. Joseph's Hospital)

Defendant Anthony D Griffin in court with attorney Nathan Opland-Dobs.  Defendant Anthony D Griffin in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Grady, Branch 23. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  Defense entered a plea of NOT GUILTY as to Counts 2 & 4.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  
  Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he/she may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he/she meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).
  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 11, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
